question_text: A technician plugs a USB 3.2 device into a USB 2.0 port. What happens?
answer_options: The device won't be recognized at all
The port will automatically upgrade to 3.2 speeds
The device will operate at USB 2.0 speeds
The device will function, but only as a charging port
correct_answer: The device will operate at USB 2.0 speeds
explanation: USB is backward compatible. A USB 3.2 device plugged into a USB 2.0 port will work but only at USB 2.0 speeds (480 Mbps).
